definition: one stumble, unable to rise (idiom); a setback leading to total collapse/ruined at a stroke/unable to recover after a minor hitch
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to shake/to flap/to vibrate/to resonate/to rise up with spirit/to rouse oneself

sentences.english: During the middle ages, Greek civilization declined and became effete.
sentences.chinese: 中世纪，古希腊文明开始衰落，一蹶不振。

sentences.english: It's a pity that someone will never stand up after a failure.
sentences.chinese: 可惜的是有些人遭到失败后一蹶不振。

sentences.english: Thus, another element of decay was introduced into Chiang's power.
sentences.chinese: 它成了使蒋政权一蹶不振的一个新因素。

sentences.english: But US's dairying henceforth has not been unable to recover in these events.
sentences.chinese: 但美国的乳业并没有在这些事件中从此一蹶不振。

sentences.english: Xiao-hui xu recovered already became a drunkard.
sentences.chinese: 徐晓辉早已一蹶不振成了酒鬼。
蹒跚而行还是一蹶不振？

sentences.english: McLaren are languishing in third with 42 points.
sentences.chinese: 一蹶不振的迈凯轮仅以42分排在第三名。

sentences.english: The Dalian team is really dead to the trend of development.
sentences.chinese: 现在这支大连队真的向一蹶不振的趋势发展。

definition: lit. to drop a thousand zhang in one fall (idiom)/fig. (of business, popularity etc) to suffer a sudden, devastating decline/to take a dive
failed and wiped over the floor (idiom); to fail utterly/a crushing defeat/beaten and in a hopeless position
rivers pour away by the day (idiom); going from bad to worse/deteriorating day by day
to fall/to drop/to decline/to deteriorate/to go downhill
to suffer defeat in every battle (idiom)
stuck and not moving forward (idiom); stagnant/in a rut/at a standstill
lit. to return to office after living as a hermit on Mount Dongshan (idiom); fig. to make a comeback
